addExternalAsset(address,address,uint256.details: Add support for the asset from the other chain, deploy new wrapped asset.

params._minAmount: Minimal amount of the asset to be wrapped.
params._supportedChainIds: Chain ids where the token of the current chain can be transfered.
params._tokenAddress: Address of the asset on the other chain.

addNativeAsset(address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Add support for the asset on the current chain.

params._minAmount: Minimal amount of current chain token to be wrapped.
params._supportedChainIds: Chain ids where native token of the current chain can be wrapped.
params._tokenAddress: Address of the asset on the current chain.

autoBurn(bytes32,address,uint256,uint256.details: Burns wrapped asset and allowss to claim it on the other chain.

params._amount: Amount of the transfered asset (note: the fee can be applyed).
params._chainIdTo: Chain id of the target chain.

autoSend(bytes32,address,uint256,uint256.details: Locks asset on the chain and enables minting on the other chain.

params._amount: Amount to be transfered (note: the fee can be applyed).
params._chainIdTo: Chain id of the target chain.

burn(bytes32,address,uint256,uint256).details: Burns wrapped asset and allowss to claim it on the other chain.

params._amount: Amount of the transfered asset (note: the fee can be applyed).
params._chainIdTo: Chain id of the target chain.

getAutoSubmisionId(bytes32,uint256,uint2.details: Calculate submission id for auto claimable transfer.

params._amount: Amount of the transfered asset (note: the fee can be applyed).

params._tokenAddress: Address of the asset on the other chain.
Address of the asset on the other chain.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

params._amount: Amount of the transfered asset (note: the fee can be applyed).

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isChainIdSupported(bytes32,uint256).details: Check if transfer to chain is supported.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

requestReserves(address,uint256).details: Request the assets to be used in defi protocol.

returnReserves(address,uint256).details: Return the assets that were used in defi protocol.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

send(bytes32,address,uint256,uint256).details: Locks asset on the chain and enables minting on the other chain.

params._amount: Amount to be transfered (note: the fee can be applyed).
params._chainIdTo: Chain id of the target chain.

setChainIdSupport(bytes32,uint256,bool).details: Set support for the chains where the token can be transfered.

params._isSupported: Whether the token is transferable to the other chain.

params._callProxy: Address of the proxy that executes external calls.

params._minAmount: Minimal amount of the asset to be wrapped.
